Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by referring to the incident as an "explosion" at a "halal nightclub" and mentioning the "death of dozens," when in reality, it was a video of security forces dispersing a protest in Kuwait.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that the video shows an explosion at a Saudi Arabian "halal nightclub."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is related to a recent incident in Saudi Arabia, without providing any concrete evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation for the video, stating that it was actually footage of a protest in Kuwait, which contradicts the claim made in the misleading Facebook post.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video has been circulating online since 2014 and has been previously reported on in the context of Kuwaiti protests, not an explosion at a Saudi Arabian nightclub.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim as it does not downplay or minimize any aspect of the situation.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in this case as the claim is consistently misleading and inaccurate.
